title: Falls of Leny Walking Route

images.title: Colin Smith / Falls of Leny
images.caption: Falls of Leny. The River Leny, or Garbh Uisge, tumbles through the wooded Pass of Leny. This view is taken from the south bank - access to the viewpoint on the north bank is closed, as is the car park on the A84.

images.title: Michael Murray / The Falls of Leny in full spate.
images.caption: The Falls of Leny in full spate.

images.caption: Dunblane, Doune and Callander Railway. View of the railway path leading to the falls.

images.caption: Turbulent flow in the Garbh Uisge

images.caption: Bridgend Cottage beside Garbh Uisge. Taken from bridge near Kilmahog

images.title: Tim Glover / Bridge carrying the A821 across Garbh Uisge
images.caption: Bridge carrying the A821 across Garbh Uisge, Kilmahog.

description: Visit these beautiful falls on this short walk from Callander in the Loch Lomond and the Trossachs National Park. You can follow a cycling and walking trail along a dismantled railway line from Callander to the falls. It's about a 2.5 mile walk along the Garbh Uisge river and the forestry of Queen Elizabeth Forest Park . It's a splendid short route with the rushing waters of the river and views of Ben Ledi and the other surrounding mountains. You can extend your walk by continuing north and visiting Loch Lubnaig . Just to the west of Callander there's another nice trail running along Loch Venachar and Loch Drunkie .
